castle.name: Adare Castle
castle.description: Castle built for strength and security on the banks of the River Maigue

castle.name: Ashford Castle
castle.description: Medieval and Victorian castle that has been turned into a five-star luxury hotel

castle.name: Belleek Castle
castle.description: Ancestral seat of the first Earl of Arran, Sir Arthur Gore, and has been expanded by the Gore family over many generations

castle.name: Blarney Castle
castle.description: Medieval stronghold built by the MacCarthy of Muskerry Dynasty and dates from 1446

castle.name: Bunratty Castle
castle.description: 15th century tower house located on the mouth of the Ratty river, which is also where it gets its name

castle.name: Charleville Castle
castle.description: Gothic-style castle, having changed owners since its foundation and is currently run by volunteers as a tourist attraction

castle.name: Dromoland Castle
castle.description: Castle located near Newmarket-on-Fergus and currently operating as a five-star luxury hotel and golf course

castle.name: Dublin Castle
castle.description: Major Irish government complex located off Dame Street in Dublin city centre

castle.name: Glenveagh Castle
castle.description: Large castellated mansion located in Glenveagh National Park and was built between 1867 and 1873

castle.name: King John's Castle
castle.description: 13th century castle located on King's Island, with the site dating back to 922

castle.name: Kilkenny Castle
castle.description: Castle built in 1260 and is a symbol of Norman occupation that was used to control a fording point

castle.name: Malahide Castle
castle.description: The estate began in 1185 and is situated close to Malahide and has over 260 acres

castle.name: Rock of Cashel
castle.description: Historical site that was the traditional seat of the king of Munster for several hundred years

castle.name: Trim Castle
castle.description: Castle built along the south bank of the the River Boyne by Hugh de Lacy over a period of 30 years
